intro: Icica heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf icica, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive variation in leaf shape and size across different parts of the plant. The species belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is known for its clusters of small, tubular flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The plant's unique morphology makes it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
